intro: Cyrtandra horizontalis, commonly known as the horizontal or creeping cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows along rocky areas and coastal habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Cyrtandra horizontalis plays a significant role in the ecological balance of its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaii's unique flora.
